intro: Laserpitium verticillatum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in whorls around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. Laserpitium verticillatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
